instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
Hey guys,

got a m1 14" here. coffee damage. amp meter shows 5V 1A

my readings:

PPBUS_AON: 7V (.450 diode mode reading)

PP3V8_AON: 2,27V (diode mode peeps, 2,7 ohm reading, cant really find a short there?)
PP5V_S2_MAIN: 0V (.384 diode mode reading)


backlight area looks bad. 


can you help me out?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
7V at PPBUS_AON with battery connected?
Did take diode mode reading at 3V8_AON disconnecting charger and battery?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
these readings from usb-c connected charger. (140w)

7V without battery connected. just charger.

diode mode readings -> without nothing connected. just the board.

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
Strange voltage, for both rails.
Can you test with other multimeter?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: no other multimeter here. multimeter should be good...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: any ideas?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: Change your multimeter battery and post again above mentioned voltages.

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
changed. PPBUS_AON = 6.87 / 6.88 V

PP3V8_AON = 2.23V

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
Remove F5200/1 and check C5250 voltage.
If still low, check all resistors and traces related with U5200.

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
fuses removed.

on C5250 12.27V / amp meter shows 5V 0.01A

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
OK, so U5200 area is good.
You have problems with some other secondary power supply derived from PPBUS_AON.
Compare diode mode to ground reading with another good board; check in both directions.

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
no other good board here.

there is a problem with PP3V8_AON. multimeter beeps. theres a short but cant detect it?

the area around q5800/20/40...?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-02098[/URL]
Does this help?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: what should i check?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: this guy: P3V8AON_SW2 beeps

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: What is the exact value in ohm scale?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: 2.8 OHM

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
Something should be detected with thermal camera, injecting 3-4V there.
Remove CPU heatsink; M1 is the first suspect...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
U8100 get up to 100 degrees celsius....

the chip itself and the area looks like new...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: Then change it...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: got no chip / donor board here. any idea where to get this awesome apple chip?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
got the chip.

removed the chip. short is still there...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: Inject voltage again; possibly bad M1 CPU...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
injected voltage again. no amps drawn...no short?

measured again before injection -> beep

mesaured again after injection .150 in diode mode.


hows that possible? good sign?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
0.150 in diode mode is far of short.
Solder new chip and test again.

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
okay. new chip is on the board.

amp meter shows: 5V / 0.08 - 0.11A unstable

3.8V are there! (PP3V8_AON)


PP5V_S2_MAIN: 2.3V-2.6V unstable.


how can i check that U8100 is soldered on correctly?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: U7700 and U8100 LDOs are stable?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: where to measure?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
I said LDOs.
Didn't see any LDO markings on these chips?
What about pages 41 & 37?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: some are there, some not, some not stable...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: Too vague information...

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message: wanna know every LDO voltage?

threads.title: 820-02098-07 - 5V 1A / liquid damage
threads.message:
There are not so many LDOs.
Some of them are marked as "NC"; not intereting, of course.
